⏰ Mastering CRON Scheduling in Jenkins and CI/CD PipelinesAutomating builds, tests, and deployments efficiently is crucial in modern DevOps workflows. One powerful tool for achieving this is CRON scheduling.In Jenkins (and many other CI/CD tools), CRON lets you define precise schedules for automated tasks using a simple syntax:```* * * * *|  |  |  |  ||  |  |  | +--- Day of the week (0-7) (Sunday=0 or 7)|  |  | +----- Month (1-12)|  | +------- Day of the month (1-31)| +--------- Hour (0-23)+----------- Minute (0-59)```Examples:- Every minute: `* * * * *`- Every day at midnight: `0 0 * * *`- Every Sunday at 3 AM: `0 3 * * 0`Using CRON effectively ensures your CI/CD pipelines run precisely when needed, optimizing resource utilization and keeping your software delivery process smooth and predictable.hashtag#DevOps hashtag#Jenkins hashtag#CICD hashtag#Automation hashtag#CRON hashtag#ContinuousIntegration hashtag#ContinuousDelivery

Day 6🚀 The Resume Mistakes That Are Costing You Your Dream Job!So, you spent years learning to code, grinding Leetcode, and acing DSA… but your job applications are still getting ghosted? 👻Chances are, your resume is the problem (not you, my friend). Here are 3 common mistakes every engineer makes and how to fix them:🔴 1. "Engineer | C | C++ | Java | Python | JavaScript | React | AWS | AI | ML | Blockchain | Web3 | DevOps | Cybersecurity | Game Dev | IoT | Cloud"Bro, are you a software engineer or the entire tech industry? 😂Fix: Focus on 3-4 relevant skills, not every buzzword in existence.🔴 2. "Worked on multiple projects using various technologies."Bhai, koi details toh de do!Fix: Be specific. Instead, write:"Built a hospital management system using MERN stack, handling 500+ patient requests daily."🔴 3. "Responsible for coding and testing software."That’s like saying "I drink water to stay hydrated." Not helping!Fix: Use action words:"Developed an automated testing framework, reducing bug reports by 30%."📌 Pro Tip: Recruiters spend less than 6 seconds scanning your resume. Make every word count! 🚀💬 Drop your resume in the comments if you want a quick review! Navigating the 2025 Job Market: A Challenging Reality for Job Seekers 💼🔍The job market in 2025 is more competitive than ever, with tightening hiring processes, automation reshaping industries, and companies focusing on cost-efficiency. For those seeking jobs, this means fewer job postings, evolving skill demands, and an increasing reliance on AI 🤖. With the U.S. unemployment rate at 4.2% and AI-driven automation affecting 60% of jobs, it’s clear that the struggle is real.Reflecting on my own journey:💠 I started my job search in August 2024, and it took me almost two weeks just to perfect my resume! Even when I thought I was done, I kept refining it 📄🔄.💠No one was around to guide me on how to apply for jobs, but Pritesh Jagani 's videos became my lifesaver. I tuned into his several podcasts 🎧 to understand how to market myself effectively.💠I can't do mass applications. An application almost takes an hour for me, first finding the right job application, then tailoring resume, asking for referral, applying, and then reaching out to recruiters. This way I find that I got better results. It's all about quality over quantity ✅.💠Reaching out to over 1000 employees on LinkedIn, I only received responses from 10 to 15 people agreeing to refer 🤝. I've applied to 300+ jobs so far. Received several emails from companies saying that the position has been filled, or has been closed. I gave a few screening rounds, and final rounds too. Every interview resulted in rejection. Disappointing, but every rejection has been a learning experience 💪. In parallel, I’ve been developing my skills, building projects 🛠️, and growing my network 🌐. While the road is tough, I’ve gained valuable insights from this journey. Here are my key takeaways:🔑 Just submitting your resume online isn’t enough—always apply via a referral 💡.🔑 Reach out to recruiters! Express why you’re a great fit for the role, show your enthusiasm for the company, and demonstrate your research on the organization 📚.🔑 Tap into your alumni network. Finding alumni from your program and requesting a brief virtual chat can unlock hidden job opportunities and expand your connections 👥.With expertise in full-stack development, AI-driven solutions, and cloud technologies, I am proficient in JavaScript, React, Node.js, Express, Python, MongoDB, and DevOps tools such as Jenkins and Docker. 💻🚀 I am continuously expanding my skill set and am open to new opportunities where I can contribute to innovative projects and further advance my career. 📈 I am currently seeking a position where I can apply my skills and experience. If you have any relevant opportunities, feel free to reach out to me—I’d be happy to connect and discuss how I can contribute to your team. 🤝hashtag#OpenToWork hashtag#Hiring hashtag#SoftwareEngineer hashtag#FullStackDeveloper hashtag#AI hashtag#JavaScript hashtag#ReactJS hashtag#NodeJS hashtag#Python hashtag#DevOps hashtag#JobSearch hashtag#TechJobs hashtag#SoftwareDevelopment

🚀 𝐌𝐚𝐬𝐭𝐞𝐫𝐢𝐧𝐠 𝐀𝐮𝐭𝐨 𝐒𝐜𝐚𝐥𝐢𝐧𝐠 𝐢𝐧 𝐀𝐖𝐒 – 𝐇𝐢𝐠𝐡 𝐀𝐯𝐚𝐢𝐥𝐚𝐛𝐢𝐥𝐢𝐭𝐲 𝐌𝐞𝐞𝐭𝐬 𝐒𝐦𝐚𝐫𝐭 𝐒𝐜𝐚𝐥𝐢𝐧𝐠! ⚙️📈As businesses grow, so should their infrastructure—𝘀𝗲𝗮𝗺𝗹𝗲𝘀𝘀𝗹𝘆 𝗮𝗻𝗱 𝗲𝗳𝗳𝗶𝗰𝗶𝗲𝗻𝘁𝗹𝘆. In my latest AWS learning session, I focused on one of the most 𝗰𝗿𝘂𝗰𝗶𝗮𝗹 𝗽𝗶𝗹𝗹𝗮𝗿𝘀 𝗼𝗳 𝗰𝗹𝗼𝘂𝗱 𝗮𝗿𝗰𝗵𝗶𝘁𝗲𝗰𝘁𝘂𝗿𝗲: 𝗔𝘂𝘁𝗼 𝗦𝗰𝗮𝗹𝗶𝗻𝗴.Here’s what I explored and practiced hands-on:🔧 𝐂𝐨𝐫𝐞 𝐂𝐨𝐧𝐜𝐞𝐩𝐭𝐬 𝐂𝐨𝐯𝐞𝐫𝐞𝐝:✅ 𝗩𝗲𝗿𝘁𝗶𝗰𝗮𝗹 𝘃𝘀 𝗛𝗼𝗿𝗶𝘇𝗼𝗻𝘁𝗮𝗹 𝗦𝗰𝗮𝗹𝗶𝗻𝗴Vertical Scaling: Upgrading a single server’s capacity.Horizontal Scaling: Adding more servers to distribute the load — the AWS way!✅ 𝗖𝗿𝗲𝗮𝘁𝗶𝗻𝗴 𝗮 𝗖𝘂𝘀𝘁𝗼𝗺 𝗔𝗠𝗜Built a tailored Amazon Machine Image to launch pre-configured instances with speed and consistency.✅ 𝗟𝗮𝘂𝗻𝗰𝗵 𝗧𝗲𝗺𝗽𝗹𝗮𝘁𝗲𝘀 & 𝗔𝘂𝘁𝗼 𝗦𝗰𝗮𝗹𝗶𝗻𝗴 𝗚𝗿𝗼𝘂𝗽𝘀Designed Launch Templates to define configurations.Created Auto Scaling Groups to ensure my app stays up—even during traffic surges or failures.✅ 𝗦𝗰𝗮𝗹𝗶𝗻𝗴 𝗣𝗼𝗹𝗶𝗰𝗶𝗲𝘀Implemented Dynamic Scaling to automatically respond to real-time demand.Set up Scheduled Actions for predictable scaling needs.✅ 𝗖𝗹𝗼𝘂𝗱𝗪𝗮𝘁𝗰𝗵 𝗔𝗹𝗮𝗿𝗺𝘀 & 𝗡𝗼𝘁𝗶𝗳𝗶𝗰𝗮𝘁𝗶𝗼𝗻𝘀Configured alarms to monitor thresholds.Enabled automated alerts for real-time updates on scaling activity.💡 𝐖𝐡𝐲 𝐓𝐡𝐢𝐬 𝐌𝐚𝐭𝐭𝐞𝐫𝐬:In today’s cloud-native world, 𝗔𝘂𝘁𝗼 𝗦𝗰𝗮𝗹𝗶𝗻𝗴 = 𝗛𝗶𝗴𝗵 𝗔𝘃𝗮𝗶𝗹𝗮𝗯𝗶𝗹𝗶𝘁𝘆 + 𝗖𝗼𝘀𝘁 𝗢𝗽𝘁𝗶𝗺𝗶𝘇𝗮𝘁𝗶𝗼𝗻 + 𝗣𝗲𝗿𝗳𝗼𝗿𝗺𝗮𝗻𝗰𝗲. It's a must-have for modern, elastic, and resilient systems.🚀 Grateful for the hands-on experience with these features, and excited to continue building my 𝗔𝗪𝗦 𝗲𝘅𝗽𝗲𝗿𝘁𝗶𝘀𝗲!Let’s connect if you're working with or hiring for roles in 𝗖𝗹𝗼𝘂𝗱, 𝗗𝗲𝘃𝗢𝗽𝘀, 𝗼𝗿 𝗜𝗻𝗳𝗿𝗮𝘀𝘁𝗿𝘂𝗰𝘁𝘂𝗿𝗲 𝗔𝘂𝘁𝗼𝗺𝗮𝘁𝗶𝗼𝗻 — I’d love to exchange insights! 🤝hashtag#AWS hashtag#CloudComputing hashtag#AutoScaling hashtag#HorizontalScaling hashtag#VerticalScaling hashtag#InfrastructureAsCode hashtag#CloudEngineer hashtag#DevOps hashtag#Hiring hashtag#TechJourney

🚀 Hands-On AWS Cloud Project: HA WordPress on ECS Fargate with Terraform, CI/CD, and Observability 🛠️I’m excited to share a major milestone in my journey toward becoming a Cloud Engineer / Cloud Solutions Architect! I just kicked off a high-availability WordPress deployment project using AWS, Terraform, and GitHub Actions, with a strong focus on cost optimization, security, and scalability. 💡🧩 Project Highlights: ✅ Infrastructure as Code: Terraform modules for VPC, ECS, RDS, ALB, CloudFront, IAM, and more. ✅ CI/CD: GitHub Actions pipeline with terraform fmt, validate, plan, and security scanning via tfsec. ✅ Secure & Scalable: Secrets Manager & SSM for configuration, Multi-AZ setup for ECS & RDS, ALB + CloudFront for performance. ✅ Monitoring & Cost Control: CloudWatch Alarms, centralized logging, and AWS Budgets to keep everything in check. ✅ Observability: Integrated Grafana Cloud dashboards for ECS, ALB, and RDS metrics 📊 ✅ Architecture Diagram: Designed with diagrams.net for clarity and planning.🔧 Tech Stack Includes: AWS (VPC, ECS Fargate, RDS, CloudFront, ALB, CloudWatch, Route 53, IAM) Terraform | GitHub Actions | tfsec | Docker | S3 | Secrets Manager | Grafana Cloud🗂️ GitHub Repository (in progress):📌 I’m building this project out in phases—each focusing on core AWS services, cost-saving techniques, automation, and secure deployment strategies.🎯 Goal: Demonstrate real-world infrastructure deployment, operational excellence, and cloud-native architecture best practices—exactly what you'd expect from a Cloud Engineer or Solutions Architect ready to hit the ground running.📣 I’d love to connect with others in the cloud space and am open to cloud engineering opportunities! hashtag#hiring *ADC Engineer II, EC2 with Security Clearance*, Herndon, *United States*, fulltime hashtag#opentowork hashtag#Herndonjobs hashtag#Virginiajobs hashtag#ITCommunications hashtag#entrylevel hashtag#firstjob hashtag#newgrad hashtag#internship hashtag#entryleveljobs *To Apply -->*: https://lnkd.in/g4Fmmq3F DESCRIPTION Would you like to help implement innovative cloud computing solutions and solve the world's most complex technical problems? Do you have a deep passion and desire to engineer and operate the world's largest cloud computing infrastructure to provide a better world for future generations? Amazon Web Services is seeking top industry technical experts to grow our team dedicated to expanding our Elastic Compute Cloud (EC2) to government customers. We are seeking a talented engineer skilled in the art of integration who understands the Agile mindset and DevOps philosophies, yet is not constrained by how "things are usually done" and is willing to decompose and reinvent systems, processes, and tools. We're looking for a technical expert for one of the largest compute services on the planet; if you possess that rare mix of depth in Operations, Networking, and Systems Engineering then we are waiting for your application. This position requires that the candidate selected must currently possess and maintain an active TS/SCI security clearance with polygraph. The position further requires the candidate to opt into a commensurate clearance for each government agency for which they perform AWS work. Key job responsibilitiesYou'll be part of a world-class team in a fast-paced environment that has the entrepreneurial feel of a start-up. This is an opportunity to operate and engineer systems on a massive scale, and to gain top-notch experience in cloud computing. You'll be surrounded by people who are smart, passionate about cloud computing, and believe that world class service is critical to customer success. You'll become expert at EC2 platform diagnosis, response, measurement, and automation. You will design and build the operational scalability that sustains the platform's insane growth. You will be able to measure your success by its visible impact on the efficiency and effectiveness of government services for our nation. A day in the lifeAmazon has a fast-paced environment where we "Work Hard, Have Fun, Make History." On a "typical" day engineers might deep dive to root cause a customer issue, investigate why a metric is trending the wrong way, consult with the top engineers at Amazon, or discuss radical new approaches to automate operational issues. About the teamWhy AWSAmazon Web Services (AWS) is the world's most comprehensive and broadly adopted cloud platform. We pioneered cloud computing and never stopped innovating - that's why customers from the most successful startups to Global 500 companies trust our robust suite of products and services to power their businesses. Is Bangalore’s IT Sector Ready for Trump’s New Tariff World?Over the past few weeks, Trump’s re-election bid has reignited his tariff-first doctrine—this time with a clearer structure: green, yellow, red buckets for trade partners. India likely sits in the “yellow” zone—strategic, but not untouchable.While the tariffs are primarily aimed at goods, the ripple effect on the U.S. economy and client behaviors will directly impact India’s $280B IT industry—especially in Bangalore, the tech capital of the world.So let’s talk real numbers and ground realities for Bangalore’s IT ecosystem:⸻Short-Term Impact (2024-2025): •	Client Anxiety = Project SlowdownsWith inflationary fears rising in the U.S. due to tariffs, clients are delaying discretionary IT spends.→ Project closures are down by 1.3% QoQ.→ Bench strength has increased by 15% in Tier 1 IT firms. •	Hiring Freeze LightHiring across software services and product-based companies is down by 22% YoY in Bangalore since Jan 2024. Lateral hiring is particularly slow. •	Revenue Dips in BFSI and RetailU.S.-based clients from banking and retail—major verticals for Indian IT—are cutting back budgets by 8–10% as per early FY25 trends.⸻Long-Term Outlook (2025-2030): •	Opportunity in U.S. Re-shoringAs U.S. firms diversify away from China/Vietnam, India can absorb that business—if it aligns its manufacturing + IT policy.→ Expect up to 3 million new tech-manufacturing crossover jobs by 2030. •	New Skilling DemandsDemand for AI, DevOps, Cybersecurity and Cloud Infra experts will surge. Bangalore must build a new tech workforce, not just more headcount. •	Strategic Green Zone?If India navigates diplomacy well, it could move into the “green bucket” of U.S. trade—with tariff relief and investment access.→ That could unlock $100B+ in bilateral digital infrastructure flows in the next 5 years.⸻The Big Picture:Yes, Trump’s tariff chaos looks messy. But behind it is a well-orchestrated global reset. If India positions itself wisely, Bangalore could emerge as the strategic tech capital in a new U.S.-aligned global order.But it will take policy agility, economic diplomacy, and workforce transformation—not business as usual.⸻Is Bangalore ready for the MAGA global reset? hashtag#BangaloreTech hashtag#TrumpTariffs hashtag#GlobalTrade hashtag#IndianIT hashtag#BangaloreJobs hashtag#DigitalIndia hashtag#TariffImpact hashtag#MakeInIndia hashtag#TechDiplomacy hashtag#GlobalEconomy hashtag#EmergingMarkets hashtag#AIJobs hashtag#USIndiaRelations hashtag#Geopolitics hashtag#SoftwareJobs hashtag#Workforce2025 hashtag#MAGAPlan hashtag#Infrastructure hashtag#JobMarket hashtag#FutureOfWork hashtag#LinkedInNews hashtag#IndiaTechLeadership
